title: Grilled Artichokes Recipes
description: These grilled artichokes with a garlic, lemon, and olive oil basting and dipping sauce are easy to make and a real crowd-pleaser at summer parties.

Meet the Allrecipes Test Kitchen Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 46 46 46 46 Prep Time: 5 mins Cook Time: 30 mins Total Time: 35 mins Servings: 4 Jump to Nutrition Facts Jump to recipe These grilled artichokes recipe are tender, flavorful, and the perfect addition to any summertime table.   How to Grill Artichokes You'll find a detailed ingredient list and step-by-step instructions in the recipe below, but let's go over the basics: Grilled Artichoke Ingredients These are the simple ingredients you’ll need to make grilled artichokes:  Artichokes: This simple recipe, which feeds four people, starts with two artichokes. Lemon: Lemon juice mixed with water will keep the trimmed artichokes from turning brown. It also adds a bright flavor. Oil: Olive oil locks in moisture and gives the seasonings something to stick to. Seasonings: These grilled artichokes are seasoned with fresh garlic, salt, and black pepper.  How to Make Grilled Artichokes Here’s a brief overview of what you can expect when you make grilled artichokes at home:  Trim and cut the artichokes and scoop out the choke. Place in lemon water. Boil the artichokes until they are tender. Make the basting sauce with lemon wedges, olive oil, garlic, salt, and pepper.Brush the artichokes with the sauce, grill, and serve with the remaining sauce.  What to Serve With Grilled Artichokes Grilled artichokes are the perfect addition to any summer grilling menu. It is reasonably easy and actually takes less time.” “I did everything as stated, but I added some wood chips to my grill,” says Pjwat. “The smoky flavor was so yummy. Didn’t even need to dip before eating!” “The flavor profile is AMAZING,” raves Ananda Syapin. “I strongly recommend getting the sauce down into the leaves before grilling.” Editorial contributions by Corey Williams Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Original recipe (1X) yields 4 servings 1 lemon, quartered 2 large artichokes ¾ cup olive oil 4 cloves garlic, chopped 1 teaspoon salt ½ teaspoon ground black pepper Directions Gather the ingredients. Fill a large bowl with cold water. Squeeze juice from one lemon wedge into water. Trim tops and stems from artichokes, cut in half from top to bottom and scoop out the choke; place halves into the bowl of lemon water to prevent them from turning brown. Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Add artichokes to boiling water, and cook until tender, about 15 minutes. Drain. Meanwhile, preheat an outdoor grill for medium-high heat. To make the basting and dipping sauce: Squeeze remaining lemon wedges into a medium bowl; stir in olive oil and garlic, and season with salt and pepper. Brush artichokes with a coating of lemon-garlic dipping sauce; place on the preheated grill and cook, basting with sauce and turning frequently, until the tips are a little charred, 5 to 10 minutes. Serve immediately with remaining lemon-garlic sauce. I Made It Print 453 home cooks made it!
